snippet: “We hope that the Russian efforts could be helpful,” Secretary of State John Kerry said, though some moderate figures have said they do not plan to attend.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry says he supports Russia's efforts to bring about peace talks between Syrian government and opposition, despite fact that some opposition leaders have declined to attend; Russia's push for talks comes as Geneva process, American-brokered peace process, has stalled.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Geneva and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: “We hope that the Russian efforts could be helpful,” Secretary of State John Kerry said, though some moderate figures have said they do not plan to attend.

headline.main: Kerry Supports Syrian Peace Talks in Russia
headline.print_headline: Kerry Supports Syrian Peace Talks in Russia
